str2: Although, though. From kai and per; and indeed, i.e. Nevertheless or notwithstanding.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Prolongation from a primary verb, another form of which, matheo, is used as an alternate in certain tenses; to learn.
Obedience, submissiveness, compliance. From hupakouo; attentive hearkening, i.e. compliance or submission.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
